itinerary.route: St. Jean Pied de Port to Roncesvalles
itinerary.mapNote: Famous monastery albergue. Pyrenees crossing complete. 950m.
Medieval bridge town. Arga River. 526m.
Capital of Navarra. San Fermín festival city. 449m.
Where the Aragonés route joins. Beautiful Roman bridge. 347m.
Historic town. Irache wine fountain 3km before. 426m.
Quiet Navarran town. Long stage across open plains. 444m.
La Rioja capital. Wine region. Tapas street Calle Laurel. 384m.
Red sandstone cliffs town. Santa María la Real monastery. 485m.

itinerary.route: Nájera to Santo Domingo de la Calzada
itinerary.mapNote: Live chickens in cathedral. Famous pilgrim miracle. 638m.
Cliff dwellings visible. Cave hermitages above town. 770m.
Small village before Atapuerca archaeological site. 1000m.
Gothic cathedral UNESCO. El Cid hometown. Major resupply. 856m.
Hidden valley village. Meseta plateau begins. 900m.
Small meseta village. Pillory column in square. 790m.

itinerary.route: Boadilla to Carrión de los Condes
itinerary.mapNote: Significant medieval town. Monastery albergues. 840m.

itinerary.route: Carrión de los Condes to Terradillos
itinerary.mapNote: Templar village. Halfway point of the Camino. 880m.
Historical crossroads. Mudéjar churches. 816m.

itinerary.route: Sahagún to Mansilla de las Mulas
itinerary.mapNote: Walled medieval town. Approaching León. 799m.

itinerary.route: Mansilla de las Mulas to León
itinerary.mapNote: Cathedral with stunning stained glass. Tapas bars. 838m.

itinerary.route: León to San Martín del Camino
itinerary.mapNote: Flat stage out of León across farmland. 870m.
Gaudí Bishop's Palace. Chocolate museum. 869m.
Ruined village on Iron Cross plateau approach. 1430m.
After Cruz de Ferro stone-dropping tradition. Templar castle. 543m.
Door of Forgiveness church. Gateway to Galicia. 511m.
Galicia border. Celtic pallozas. Fog and rain country begins. 1330m.
Eucalyptus and oak forests. Medieval limestone quarry town. 665m.
Last point for Compostela certificate. 100km mark. 453m.
Medieval church moved stone by stone from reservoir. 370m.
Capital of Galician rural heartland. Rolling green hills. 565m.
Famous Galician cheese (Arzúa-Ulloa DOP). 385m.
Final night before arrival. Eucalyptus forests. 330m.

itinerary.route: O Pedrouzo to Santiago de Compostela
itinerary.mapNote: Cathedral arrival. Pilgrim Mass. Botafumeiro. 260m.
World's end. Lighthouse. Traditional boot burning. 0m.

waypoints.name: Col de Lepoeder (Pyrenees)
waypoints.note: Napoleon Route high point. First view into Spain. 1430m.

waypoints.name: Cruz de Ferro
waypoints.note: Iron Cross. Pilgrims leave a stone from home here. Tradition 1000yrs+.

waypoints.name: O Cebreiro
waypoints.note: Gateway to Galicia. Celtic pallozas round houses. Often in cloud.

waypoints.name: Burgos Cathedral
waypoints.note: UNESCO Gothic cathedral. El Cid's tomb. Major trail milestone.

waypoints.name: León Cathedral
waypoints.note: Best stained glass in Spain. Pilgrims' hospital beside. 1800 windows.

waypoints.name: Santiago Cathedral
waypoints.note: Trail end. Pilgrim Mass. Botafumeiro incense burner swings across nave.

waypoints.name: Meseta Plateau
waypoints.note: 200km of open Castilian wheat fields. Meditative — or maddening.

waypoints.name: Finisterre Lighthouse
waypoints.note: 'World's End'. Roman finis terrae. Traditional boot burning.
